data.title: capital
data.meta_description: CAPITAL translate: capitale [feminine], capital [masculine], majuscule [feminine], capitale [feminine], capital/-ale…. Learn more in the Cambridge English-French Dictionary.
data.text:
noun

/ˈkæpɪtl/

● [ countable ]

a city where a country or region’s main government is located

capitale [ feminine ]

Berlin is the capital of Germany. Berlin est la capitale de l’Allemagne.

officials working in the state capital des fonctionnaires travaillant dans la capitale de l’état

● [ uncountable ]

money used to make money

capital [ masculine ]

looking for capital to start a business recherchant un capital pour monter une affaire

capital expenditure utilisation de capital

● [ countable ]

the large form of a letter

majuscule [ feminine ]

Write your name in capitals/in capital letters. Inscrivez votre nom en lettres majuscules.

capitale [ feminine ]

Las Vegas is the gambling capital of the U.S. Las Vegas est la capitale du jeu des U.S.A.

capital

adjective

/ˈkæpɪtl/

●

receiving the punishment of death

capital/-ale

a capital offense un crime capital

See also

●

(of letter of alphabet) written in its large form

(en) majuscule

Bangor starts with a capital B. Bangor s’écrit avec un B majuscule.

(Translation of capital from the GLOBAL English-French Dictionary © 2016 K Dictionaries Ltd)

Translation of capital | PASSWORD English-French Dictionary

capital

noun

/ˈkӕpitl/

●

capitale

Paris is the capital of France.

●

(also capital letter) any letter of the type found at the beginning of sentences, proper names etc

majuscule

THESE ARE CAPITAL LETTERS / CAPITALS.

● business

money (for investment etc)

capital

You need capital to start a new business.

capital

noun

/ˈkӕpitl/

●

in architecture, the top part of a column of a building etc

chapiteau

the capitals of the ancient Temple of Saturn.

(Translation of capital from the PASSWORD English-French Dictionary © 2014 K Dictionaries Ltd)

A2,A2
